intro: Guatteria hilariana var. pallescens, commonly known as the pale-leaved guatteria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central America and northern South America. The plant is characterized by its broad, leathery leaves that are typically pale green in color. It produces small, fragrant white flowers that are clustered in panicles, followed by edible, round berries. This species is often found in humid, lowland forests and is valued for its ornamental and medicinal properties.
